name: Mustard Glazed Corned Beef
author: JAMVS
summary: This is a great tasting, tender corned beef that you simmer in seasonings then glaze and finish in the broiler.  Great tasting and a nice alternative to the traditional boiled corned beef.  So easy and only a few ingredients.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons prepared yellow mustard, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place the corned beef brisket into a Dutch oven, and season with pickling spice
Fill with enough water to cover the roast, and place the lid on
Bake for 2 1/2 hours in the preheated oven
Then, remove it from the Dutch oven and place on a broiler pan
While the meat is roasting, mix together the corn syrup and mustard in a small saucepan
Bring to a boil, and cook over medium heat until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes
Spread the mustard glaze over the roast, and broil for 5 to 7 minutes, until the glaze is shiny
